title: Interpret confidence interval for mean sleep hours

content.question: A random sample of 50 students at a large high school resulted in a 95 percent confidence interval for the mean number of hours of sleep per day of (6.73, 7.67). Which of the following statements best summarizes the meaning of this confidence interval?

choices.label: About 95% of all random samples of 50 students from this population would result in a 95% confidence interval of (6.73, 7.67).
About 95% of all random samples of 50 students from this population would result in a 95% confidence interval that covered the population mean number of hours of sleep per day.
95% of the students in the survey reported sleeping between 6.73 and 7.67 hours per day.
95% of the students in this high school sleep between 6.73 and 7.67 hours per day.
A student selected at random from this population sleeps between 6.73 and 7.67 hours per day for 95% of the time.

content.answer: About 95% of all random samples of 50 students from this population would result in a 95% confidence interval that covered the population mean number of hours of sleep per day.

topic.text: 7.3: Justifying a Claim About a Population Mean Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
